terms.name: Energy
terms.definition: The shared team resource used to play cards. By default, at Turn Start each team sets Energy to 5; effects can modify this and there is no Energy cap.

terms.name: Ultimate Meter
terms.definition: The shared team resource that powers the strongest abilities; any character can spend it. Your team gains Ultimate Meter when you play cards. Design target: in a standard 3v3 match, a normal team gains about 5 Ultimate Meter per turn on average; some characters gain faster or slower.

terms.name: Spend
terms.definition: When an effect says to Spend X (Energy, Ammo, a status value, etc.), you must reduce that resource by X to resolve that part of the effect. If you cannot spend the full amount, that part of the effect does not happen. Optional Spend must say "may."

terms.name: Ultimate Card
terms.definition: A card that starts outside the draw pile and is always available to play. It follows normal card rules and counts as an Ultimate type for effects.

terms.name: Ammo
terms.definition: A per-weapon resource tracked separately for each weapon (example: Handgun Ammo, Shotgun Ammo). Cards may require or spend Ammo; if you cannot spend the required amount, that effect does not activate. "Full" means the amount granted by the effect or innate that set the Ammo. Switching weapons does not change each weapon's stored Ammo unless stated.

terms.name: Reload
terms.definition: Lose all current Ammo for the currently equipped weapon, then set that weapon's Ammo to its full value as defined by its source.

terms.name: Initiative
terms.definition: Determines who takes the first action at Combat Start each turn.

terms.name: Movement Round
terms.definition: A phase after Turn Start where players alternate priority to spend 1 Energy to swap two adjacent allied characters or pass. Movement swaps are not card plays and do not grant Ultimate Meter. The round ends when both players pass consecutively. Rooted characters cannot be moved or swapped. See FAQ: faq.md#faq-movement-round.

terms.name: Rule Priority
terms.definition: If a card or character effect contradicts the core rules, apply the effect as written.

terms.name: On Gain
terms.definition: A status effect timing label that resolves immediately when the status is gained, even mid-turn. See FAQ: faq.md#faq-on-gain.

terms.name: On Hit
terms.definition: A timing label that resolves when an Attack is a hit, even if it deals 0 damage. See FAQ: faq.md#faq-hit-vs-damage.

terms.name: On Damage
terms.definition: A timing label that resolves when damage is actually dealt after mitigation, whether to Shield, Barrier, or HP. Damage must be greater than 0. See FAQ: faq.md#faq-hit-vs-damage.

terms.name: On HP Damage
terms.definition: A timing label that resolves when HP is reduced by damage after mitigation. See FAQ: faq.md#faq-hit-vs-damage.

terms.name: Discard
terms.definition: The act of moving a card from your hand to the Discard Pile. Unplayed cards are typically discarded at the end of each turn. Some card effects also cause you to discard cards during your turn.

terms.name: Draw
terms.definition: The act of taking cards from your Draw Pile and adding them to your hand. If you need to draw and your Draw Pile is empty, shuffle your Discard Pile into a new Draw Pile and continue drawing; if both piles are empty, draw as many as possible (possibly 0). By default, at Turn Start you draw until you reach a hand size of 5, modified by draw effects (if any). See FAQ: faq.md#faq-draw-reshuffle.

terms.name: Hand
terms.definition: Your team's shared hand of cards. Any character may play cards from the shared hand as long as they can legally play that card. See FAQ: faq.md#faq-shared-hand-energy.

terms.name: Played
terms.definition: A card is played when it is placed in a legal zone after paying its cost and selecting legal targets.

terms.name: Cannot Play Cards
terms.definition: If an effect says a player cannot play cards, they cannot add cards to any zone until the restriction ends; they may still pass priority and resolve cards already played. See FAQ: faq.md#faq-cannot-play-cards.

terms.name: Used
terms.definition: A card is used when its effects apply. Unless a timing is explicitly stated, a card's text is On Use.

terms.name: Becomes
terms.definition: If a card becomes another card due to a condition, treat it as that other card in any zone (deck, hand, play) as long as the condition is true. This replacement is automatic, not optional.

terms.name: Cancelled
terms.definition: A cancelled card skips its effects from Before Use onward (Before Use, On Use, On Hit, After Use). Always still applies.

terms.name: Negated
terms.definition: A negated card skips all effects, including Always.

terms.name: Basic Card
terms.definition: A card tagged Basic. Each character has two Basic cards in their starting five.

terms.name: Technique Card
terms.definition: A non-basic, non-ultimate card from a character's kit. Each character has three Technique cards in their starting five.

terms.name: Created Card
terms.definition: A card generated by an effect that did not start in a character's initial five cards. If the effect does not specify where it goes, add it to the discard pile.

terms.name: Role
terms.definition: A character archetype tag used to communicate playstyle. See roles: roles.md.

terms.name: Defeated
terms.definition: A character is defeated when their HP reaches 0. Defeated characters cannot be targeted or play cards, and their cards are removed from play. The match ends when all characters on a team are defeated.

terms.name: Resurrection
terms.definition: An effect that returns a defeated character to play. The effect must explicitly state how it restores that character; otherwise the character remains defeated.

terms.name: Combat Round
terms.definition: A sequence that begins when the initiative player plays a card and ends when all zones are empty.

terms.name: Active Zone
terms.definition: The current zone being played in; cards in it are used during a Combat Round.

terms.name: Priority
terms.definition: The right to act next during Combat or the Movement Round. Priority passes after each play, swap, or pass.

terms.name: Hit
terms.definition: An Attack that is used is a hit unless a rule or effect prevents it (example: Evade). See FAQ: faq.md#faq-evade-shield.

terms.name: Damage
terms.definition: Damage reduces Shield, Barrier, or HP. Effects that say "Lose HP" are not damage.

terms.name: Healing
terms.definition: Effects that restore HP. Healing is reduced by Wound and Wither before it is gained. See FAQ: faq.md#faq-healing-reduction.

terms.name: Damage Resolution
terms.definition: Apply damage in this order: roll Power and apply Power modifiers, apply Immune, apply percent damage modifiers (Fortified/Vulnerable), apply Shield, apply Barrier, apply flat HP modifiers (Resist/Weakness/Absorb), then deal remaining damage to HP. See FAQ: faq.md#faq-damage-resolution.

terms.name: Damage Types & Attack Tags
terms.definition: Cards can list multiple Damage Types (Physical, Magical, Mental, Electric) and Attack Tags (Slash, Pierce, Blunt, Multihit). A card counts as all listed types and tags for matching. If a single modifier lists multiple types or tags, it applies once when any match; separate modifiers stack.

terms.name: Base Power
terms.definition: Design baseline for setting a card's Power. Default target: Energy cost x 10 or Ultimate Meter cost x 1.5, rounded down. Adjust upward for hard requirements or downward for extra utility as needed.

terms.name: Power
terms.definition: The min-max value shown on a card. It is usually +/- floor(Base Power x 0.20) for Melee and +/- floor(Base Power x 0.25) for Ranged. Power cannot be reduced below 0.

terms.name: Power Roll
terms.definition: The rolled value from a card's Power used for clash comparisons, damage dealt, Shield gained, and HP recovered. Roll Power each time a card is used.

terms.name: Reuse
terms.definition: If a card is instructed to Reuse, do not discard it after its clash; keep it in the current zone so it can be paired again during the same zone resolution.

terms.name: Shield
terms.definition: Temporary protection that soaks damage before HP. At Turn End, remove all Shield.

terms.name: Barrier
terms.definition: A persistent damage buffer from the Barrier status effect that absorbs damage after Shield and before HP.

terms.name: Ally
terms.definition: A character on the same team, including self unless an effect says another ally.

terms.name: Allies
terms.definition: All characters on the same team, including self.

terms.name: Enemy
terms.definition: A character on the opposite team.

terms.name: Enemies
terms.definition: All characters on the opposite team.

terms.name: Self
terms.definition: The character that uses the card.

terms.name: Adjacent
terms.definition: Each team has its own line arranged left to right. Adjacent means the immediate left or right neighbor of the target on the same team line.

terms.name: Opposed
terms.definition: Characters are opposed if they are in the same column on opposing team lines.

terms.name: Redirect
terms.definition: A keyword that changes the primary target of a single-target effect. Redirect can apply even if the effect has Splash or Bounce; resolve those from the new target. See FAQ: faq.md#faq-redirect-splash.

terms.name: AoE
terms.definition: Area of Effect. All characters in the targeted area take the effect.

terms.name: Bounce
terms.definition: A card with the Bounce area tag affects the main target and a random adjacent character.

terms.name: Splash
terms.definition: An adjacent character to the main target will also take the effect.

terms.name: Halve
terms.definition: Set the current value to half its current value, rounding down (floor).

terms.name: Rounding
terms.definition: Any time a calculation results in a decimal, round down (floor).
